text: Raymond Merrill Smullyan (; May 25, 1919 â€“ February 6, 2017) was an American mathematician, concert pianist, logician, Taoist philosopher, and magician. Smullyan was born in Far Rockaway, New York. His first career was stage magic. He then earned a BSc from the University of Chicago in 1955 and his Ph.D. from Princeton University in 1959. He was one of many logicians to have studied under Alonzo Church. Smullyan died on February 6, 2017 in Hudson, New York at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1919 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American mathematicians Category:American pianists Category:American philosophers Category:Academics from New York (state) Category:American magicians Category:Scientists from New York (state) Category:Writers from New York (state) Category:Musicians from New York (state) Category:Entertainers from New York (state)
title: Raymond Smullyan
